components.description:
A tall, ceramic jar with two handles and a narrow neck and foot. Represents an amphora, as used by ancient Greeks and Romans to hold water and wine.

Generally depicted as brownish-red earthenware ornamented with black and a Greek meander pattern.

May represent containers like vases, pottery, museums, history, and antiquity. May also be used in relation to the zodiac sign of Aquarius, the Water-Bearer.

Not to be confused with ‚ö±Ô∏è Funeral Urn.
components.title: Amphora

version.description: The Unicode Consortium has approved the following 41 emoji characters as part of Unicode 8.0, released on June 17, 2015. This is comprised of 37 new emojis, plus five emoji modifiers. Find out more about this update on the Emojipedia Blog.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Miscellaneous mark
emoji_net_data.definition: A ceramic, vase-like object. Can be used in relation to the zodiac symbol Aquarius. Amphora was approved as part of Unicode 8.0 in 2015 and  http://emojipedia.org/amphora/
emoji_net_data.name: amphora

bn:00087321v: To drink or imbibe with vigour or relish; to drink copiously; to swallow in large draughts.
To consume a liquid through the mouth.
To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.

bn:15821299n: Someone with a Aquarius star sign.
Someone with an Aquarius star sign
Aquarius is the eleventh astrological sign in the Zodiac, originating from the constellation Aquarius.

bn:00010183n: Kind of liquid which is specifically prepared for human consumption
Any one of various liquids for drinking.
Drinks, or beverages, are liquids specifically prepared for human consumption.

bn:00079628n: A container used mainly for displaying fresh, dried, or artificial flowers.
Open container, often used to hold cut flowers
A vase is an open container, often used to hold cut flowers.
An open jar of glass or porcelain used as an ornament or to hold flowers
Container used mainly for displaying flowers.

bn:00003657n: A two handled jar with a narrow neck that was used in ancient times to store or carry wine or oils.
An ancient crockery, a kind of vase
An ancient jar with two handles and a narrow neck; used to hold oil or wine
An amphora is a type of container of a characteristic shape and size, descending from at least as early as the Neolithic Period.
A two handled jar with a narrow neck.

bn:00028749n: A single serving of a beverage

bn:00077453n: A container for holding and pouring liquids with a handle and a spout.
A jug is a type of container commonly used to hold liquid.
The amount that a jug can hold.
A drinking mug, in the shape of a human head with a hat atop.
A drinking mug in the shape of a stout man wearing a three-cornered hat

bn:00048023n: A jar is a rigid, approximately cylindrical container with a wide mouth or opening.
A small, approximately cylindrical container, normally made of glass or clay, for holding fruit, preserves, etc., or for ornamental purposes.
A vessel (usually cylindrical) with a wide mouth and without handles
Rigid, approximately cylindrical container with a wide mouth or opening
